abstract: Certain cytokines that are produced in liver may act as growth factors to facilitate wound healing and. hence. may influence liver regeneration. However. this hypothesis has not been directly tested. To determine whether the cytokine response evoked by partial

title: Toll-like receptors and their ligands control mesenchymal stem cell functions
author: ['M Pevsner-Fischer', 'V Morad', 'M Cohen-Sfady']
abstract: Mesenchymal stem cells (MSCs) are widespread in adult organisms and may be involved in tissue maintenance and repair as well as in the regulation of hematopoiesis and immunologic responses. Thus. it is important to discover the factors controlling MSC renewal

title: Osteoimmunology: interactions of the bone and immune system
author: ['J Lorenzo', 'M Horowitz', 'Y Choi']
abstract: Bone and the immune system are both complex tissues that respectively regulate the skeleton and the body's response to invading pathogens. It has now become clear that these organ systems often interact in their function. This is particularly true for the development of

title: Role of monocytes in atherogenesis
author: ['B Østerud', 'E Bjørklid']
abstract: Østerud. Bjarne. and Eirik Bjørklid. Role of Monocytes in Atherogenesis. Physiol Rev 83: 1069-1112. 2003; 10.1152/physrev. 00005.2003.—This review focuses on the role of monocytes in the early phase of atherogenesis. before foam cell formation. An emerging
